"Foreign citizens, as well as stateless persons who are on the territory of Kyrgyzstan in a visa and visa-free order, can leave the territory of the Kyrgyz Republic until May 1, 2020 without issuing exit visas and having a registration at the place of stay."

Bremen, a state in Germany, has enforced a new regulation on all citizens on April 3, 2020, in order to prevent new infections with the Coronavirus, related to the law of preventing infectious diseases.
It is a regulation, covering the areas of quarantine for infected persons, and people coming back from risk areas and their obligations to regularly check on their health.
It is also prohibiting mass gatherings, and limiting presence on public spaces to two people, unless the group is living in the same household, or connected to system-relevant services. It is also enforcing social distancing measures, requiring the distance of 1,5 meters between persons in public.
There is no indication as to when the policy is supposed to end.
Pharmacies to Dispense Medicines through Window

India issues following policy — 
"Visa free travel facility granted to OCI card holders is kept in abeyance till April 15th 2020. This will come into effect from 1200 GMT on 13th March 2020 at the port of departure."
On March 30, Kyrgyzstan urged people to self-isolate and to go out of their homes as little as possible.

On March 9 and March 10, Hesse (Germany) will start setting up central examination units at selected locations of medical on-call services to relieve the burden on general practitioners' practices and allow for a more economical use of the limited resources currently available.
Oman suspends all flights
The Republic of the Congo government announced "the immediate closure and until further notice of all borders" on March 21st, 2020 after the 4th confirmed case

entry_type: Correction to Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description:
On April 3, 2020, Bremen, a state in Germany, has enforced a new regulation on all citizens, in order to prevent new infections with the Coronavirus.
   It is a regulation covering the areas of quarantine for infected persons, as well as people coming back from risk areas, and obligations to regularly check on their health. 
It is enforcing social distancing measures, requiring the distance of 1,5 meters between persons in public. 
   It is prohibiting mass gatherings, the operation of non-system relevant businesses at which a distance of 1,5 m cannot be guaranteed, and limiting presence on public spaces to two people, unless the group is living in the same household, or connected to system-relevant services.
Schools, universities and care facilities remain closed until April 19, 2020. 
Misconducts can be prosecuted with a fine.
Lesotho closing schools from March 18th until April 17th
Kyrgyzstan: "from March 31 the passage of vehicles into the Naryn town has been blocked."
The provincial government of Papua raised the province's state of alert (Status Siaga Darurat) to state of emergency, from March 24.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: The Major of the city Mongo declared that the central market has to close. This concerns all non-food businesses.Some restaurants to allowed to keep working. This restriction starts after April 1 2020.

On March 17, 2020, Benin instructs the Health Ministry to count additional health personnel to support health care if needed, such as retired doctors and paramedics, anesthetists ("réanimateurs") and other volunteers
"System of mass laboratory diagnosis of COVID-19 will be launched in Kyrgyzstan. The project is planned to be implemented at the expense of sponsors and entrepreneurs," as announced on April 2.

In Guyana, the Minister of Public Health has issued emergency measures to contain the spread of the Novel Coronavirus.

It will be in effect from April 3 to May 3, 2020. These measures, among other things, supervised the implementation of a 6 pm to 6 am curfew while only catering for the operations of essential services on a 24-hour basis.

With these emergency measures now published all curfews or measures taken by town councils and village/community leaders and others are revoked except those made by the Ministers responsible for Education, Civil Aviation, Maritime, Immigration and Finance.

A statement by the Antigua Public Utility Authority informed the public about social distancing and hygiene measures on March 16th. "Senior citizens will be given priority in customer lines, to limit exposure, controlled lines at our payment centers will be enforced, utilization of sanitization stationswill be made compulsory upon entrance of offices, a designated waiting area will be provided to facilitate the recommended social distance."

Lesotho is under three-week national lockdown effective March 30th until April 21st. Full restriction of movement. Only those in essential services like health, security, utilities, banking and supermarkets will be working.

US announces that Tax Day will be moved from April 15 to July 15. No interest or penalties will be charged for filing during this extended window, but any American expecting refunds or credits may claim now to get their money sooner.
To minimize impact on our nation’s students, the Department of Education is temporarily waiving all interest on federally held student loans. Secretary Betsy DeVos has also directed federal lenders to allow borrowers to suspend their student loan payments without penalty for at least the next 60 days.

Announced March 30, 2020, Cameroon's Ministry of Public Health will begin a door-to-door testing campaign from April 4 to April 7 in the Littoral Region of Cameroon, which includes Cameroon's largest city Douala. Teams from the Ministry of Public Health will move from door-to-door to ensure the whole population of the Littoral region are aware of precautionary measures against the COVID-19 pandemic and if deemed necessary they will be screened. Nearly 1,500 community health workers are mobilized, and supported by the Urban Community of Douala and the city halls of the city districts. Laboratories have been equipped to henceforth test and analyze results of screened samples in the Littoral region.

In Guyana, all ‘in person’ hearings have been suspended until further notice.
“These updated directions in relation to the COVID-19 pandemic are in addition to the Supreme Court of Judicature Practice Directions COVID-19 Emergency Directions, Gazetted on 23rd March, 2020.” The Supreme Court stated in a media release.
With immediate effect, the court said these measures will be in place lasting until April 24, 2020.
In Turkey, as of March 16, all schools will be shut down until 30 March
US president Trump Approves New York Disaster Declaration making federal funding available, March 20 2020.
Indonesian President calls for the people to practise social distancing on March 15.
President Donald J. Trump Approves Washington State Disaster Declaration making federal funding available, March 22, 2020.
The Ivory Coast enforces a curfew prohibiting circulation from 9 pm to 5 am from the 24th of March onward.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description:
As of 00:00 on 18.03.2020, the entry into the territory of the Republic of Bulgaria will be temporarily prohibited for citizens of all States with registered COVID-19 cases.

An exception will be made for those citizens who have a permanent, long-term or continued residence in the Republic of Bulgaria, as well as the members of their families.

As of March 13, Hesse (Germany) orders all persons who have stayed in an area at risk for infection with the SARS-CoV-2 virus to be isolated for 14 days. This includes a ban on working if they work as functional personnel. This measure is in effect until April 19.
Lesotho closes borders with South Africa for everyone except for those who transport food and medical items.
On March 10th, 2020 the Government of Rhineland-Palatinate, Germany advised for all events in the state with more than 1000 participants not to take place.
As of March 12, 2020 the state of Bremen (Germany) is prohibiting all mass gatherings and events with more than 1000 visitors. For smaller events, general hygienic measures have to be observed.
March 22, 2020 the US Federal Government issues a Memorandum on Providing Federal Support for Governors’ Use of the National Guard to Respond to COVID-19.
In Ramallah, Palestine, on March 11, 2020 it was announced that a new new Department opens at a major hospital in order to examine and diagnose cases of COVID-19.
On March 17, 2020, Benin states that a governmental committee will make a daily evaluation of the situation with regard to taking further adequate measures at the time given

The White House announced on March 23, 2020 the launch of the COVID-19 High Performance Computing Consortium to provide COVID-19 researchers worldwide with access to the world’s most powerful high performance computing resources that can significantly advance the pace of scientific discovery in the fight to stop the virus.
The Ivory Coast closes all bars and restaurants from the 23rd of March onward.

Effective March 31, 2020, drinking in off-licences, bars and other drinking spots and eating in restaurants has been prohibited in the South West region of Cameroon as a way to curb the rapid spread of the Coronavirus pandemic. The decision is contained in a release signed by the South West regional governor, Bernard Okalia Balia, dated Tuesday March 31, 2020. According to the release, all those who will buy food from restaurants and drinks from drinking spots will have to take them home for consumption.

I the Chadian City bongor in the province of Mayo Kebbi Est, a brigade was formed. This force was installed to inform the citicens and implament the Governments measures. The brigade was launched on March 27.
On March, 14th, 2020 the government of Rheinland-Pfalz, Germany announced that it increased the testing capacity of its facilities to 120 per day.

In Guyana, the Ministry of Public Health will soon launch an App that will allow persons to self-test for COVID-19. This is expected to be rolled out on April 5, 2020, on the National Communications Network.

With the app, persons can test themselves for the virus, after which the information will go directly to the surveillance team. After self-testing, persons will be contacted by the surveillance team once they fit any of the following scenarios.

1. If you have traveled and during the 14 days you begin to have a cough, fever or shortness of breath
2. If you have been in contact with someone who has tested positive for COVID-19 and during 14 days since that meeting you begin to have – a cough, fever or shortness of breath.
3. If you visited a facility where COVID-19 positive cases have been identified and during the 14 days after that visit you begin to have a cough, fever or shortness of breath
On March 15th, 2020 the government of Rheinland-Pfalz, Germany announced that it will cooperate with the BASF company to produce desinfection agents.
On March 2, 2020, the Ministry of Health in Palestine announced the opening of a new quarantine center at the Gaza border to Egypt.

Effective April 2, 2020, the Governor of the Littoral Region of Cameroon has further restricted non-essential businesses, limiting restaurants and bars by prohibiting the consumption of food or drinks in public spaces. In a release signed by the Littoral Governor, Samuel Dieudonne Ivaha Diboua dated April 2, the population of the region is invited to take home every eatable and drinkable stuff they buy from their selling points. This decision seeks to limit the unnecessary gathering of people in restaurants, commercial enterprises and drinking spots, a move that will ensure many stay home as much as possible to stop the spread of the Coronavirus pandemic. In the communique, Governor Samuel Dieudonne Ivaha Diboua notes that forces of law and order and Administrative officials will have to ensure that this decision is respected.

March 23, 2020 the US government issues an Executive Order on Preventing Hoarding of Health and Medical Resources to Respond to the Spread of COVID-19.
The president writes "Accordingly, I am delegating to the Secretary my authority under section 102 of the Act (50 U.S.C. 4512) to prevent hoarding of health and medical resources necessary to respond to the spread of COVID-19 within the United States. I am also delegating to the Secretary my authority under the Act to implement any restrictions on hoarding, including my authority under section 705 of the Act (50 U.S.C. 4555) to gather information, such as information about how supplies of such resources are distributed throughout the Nation.
Vanuatu's southern-most island Aneityum is under lockdown after a tourist who visited was tested as positive for covid-19. 03-23-2020

President Donald J. Trump Approves Louisiana Disaster Declaration, March 24, 2020.

The Ivory Coast invests 95 West African CFA francs in the "response plan" against the COVID- 19 epidemic on the 26th of March.
On March 17th, 2020 the government of Rheinland-Pfalz, Germany announced that it will increase its intensive care capacities and ventilator stock by about 50%.
March 25, 2020 President Donald J. Trump Approves Florida Disaster Declaration.
As of March 13, Hesse (Germany) is prohibiting visitation at medical facilities, shelters, mass accommodations, prisons, and similar collective accommodations until April 19.

The provincial government of Central Java issued a closure on recreational facilities from March 16-29.

Vanuatu, 03-23-2020, schools in SHEFA, SANMA and TAFEA will be closed starting this week until further notice, to prepare for the possibility of extended closure.

As of March 14, Hesse (Germany) declares that contact with other people outside the members of one's own household should be reduced to the absolute necessary minimum. Being in public places is only permitted alone, with one other person not living in the own household or in the circle of members of the own household. A minimum distance of 1.5 metres must be maintained when meeting other people.
The Ministry of Environment and Forestry closes 56 conservation sites for the public, effective on March 19.

On 25 March 2020, the Australian Health Minister has determined that an Australian citizen or permanent resident must not travel outside of Australia (by air or sea or the operator of an outgoing aircraft or vessel), unless an exemption is granted to them. The Determination commences at 12.00pm on 25 March 2020 and is in force for an initial period of 4 weeks. A further revision of this arrangement can occur towards the end of the period to assess whether it continues to be necessary.

Taiwan CECC requisitiones masks (including for children) and allocated masks to the local government health bureau to meet emergency epidemic prevention needs on Feb. 2.

event_description: On Mar 12 the Irish government asked people at a higher risk "to stay in protective self-separation, if the virus is circulating in their community" until Mar 29th.

India issues following plan for nationals in Italy — 
"Provision for testing primarily for students/compassionate cases in Italy to be made and collection for samples to be organized accordingly. Those tested negative will be allowed to travel and will be
quarantined on arrival in India for 14 days."
There is no data found for any Corona related actions inside Yemen before mid of March 2020. The only entry to be found is in the beginning of February targeting Yemeni nationals in Wuhan.
Idaho, United States

Taiwan Ministry of Economic Affairs (MOEA) has issued a requisition for  companies that have medical equipment licenses and factory registration certificates on Jan. 31. For the remaining 37 mask manufacturers who have production facts but are relatively small, the Ministry of Health and Welfare (MOHW) has also issued the fourth batch of mask requisitions. The mask production of 66 companies with production facts has been fully requisitioned on Feb 13.
As of March 18, Hesse (Germany) declares a limitation of non-essential medical interventions as well as a reporting obligation for the posession/availability of ventilators until April 19.

Ethiopia launched a national resource mobilisation committee tasked with coordinating efforts of gathering financial and non-financial materials for COVID-19 emergency preparedness, including the donation of a month of salary of its members, on March 25.
As of March 19, non-Cabo Verdean citizens will not be permitted entry for a period of three weeks. This travel restriction will reviewed by the Government of Cabo Verde at the end of this period.

entry_type: Correction to Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: On March 15, 2020, it is announced that the Hamas closed all border crossings to Gaza.
On March 3, 2020, Benin urges anyone who is aware of cases of people returning home from countries at risk to report it immediately by calling a hotline (health monitoring)

on Jan. 31 Taiwan Executive Yuan launches special funding (about 200 million NTD) to purchase mask production equipments building 60 mask production lines to reach the total daily mask production capacity of 10 million pieces per day.
Russia restricts flights to/from the US, UK, and UAE, except for those into Moscow's Sheremetyevo airport and charter flights for the purpose of repatriating citizens from March 20

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: As of March 16, Hesse (Germany) has initiated a permanent crisis unit that  advises the Corona Committee which had previously been established. The crisis unit centrally controls the large number of interdepartmental measures, enables uniform internal coordination and communication within the authorities, and provides a single contact point for counties, towns, municipalities, and all hazard prevention authorities.

entry_type: Correction to Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: On March 15, 2020 the Hamas announced that all schools, universities and kindergartens in Gaza will be closed until the end of March.

Intensification of media and awareness campaigns to raise awareness of the importance of quarantine adherence for travelers returning from at-risk areas, with the aim of ensuring the inclusion of all in the national plan to fight COVID -19. From March 4th.
On March 20, Hesse (Germany) calls on students with medical and nursing skills to offer their help in fighting the corona pandemic.
Taiwan CECC raises travel notice level for Iran to Level 2: Alert; travelers advised to practice enhanced precautions.

Nevada, United States
Today, the Nevada Health Response Center (NHRC) released the COVID-19 Risk Mitigation Initiative (see attached PDF). The NHRC email server is currently down, so in order to get this distributed to the public, the Governor's Office is delivering this email.
The Cape Verdean Government has suspended all air connections from Italy for a period of three weeks, until March 20, but which may be extended.
Ireland passed an Emergency legislation on Mar 28 "to help businesses to keep their staff in work, increase social welfare payments, freeze rents".
The regency of Bogor announced a state of emergency on April 1.

entry_type: Correction to Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: As of March 21, 2020, the Bulgarian government restricts the free entry to all parks, sport- and playgrounds and all other public indoor and outdoor places.

entry_type: Correction to Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: In Palestine, March 06, "The Palestinian Authority has declared a state of emergency in the occupied West Bank over the coronavirus epidemic after seven people tested positive."

event_description: As of March 21, Hesse (Germany) prohibits public and non-public events with an actual or expected number of more than 5 participants until April 19.
India issues suspends international passenger traffic through Land Check Posts along following borders — Indo-Bangladesh, Indo-Nepal, Indo-Bhutan, Indo-Myanmar (few check posts are exceptions).

event_description:
Nevada, United States
Today, Governor Steve Sisolak announced that sixteen of Nevada’s seventeen school districts and all of Nevada’s charter schools submitted plans to the Nevada Department of Education and are approved to continue or start distance education as of Monday, March 23.

There is currently no quarantine in place. However, individuals arriving from China (and possible other locations with person-to-person transmission), may be required to stay at home isolated from others for at least 14 days
On January 23 2020, the UAE announced that all passengers arriving from China will have to undergo thermal screening at the airports.
Suspend the exchange of students and student delegations abroad, unless absolutely necessary, while taking the necessary health precautions from March 4th.
The Indonesian National Police issued a ban on mass gatherings, to take into effect from March 19.

Nevada, United States
Today, Governor Sisolak announced that effective immediately, the Nevada Division of Emergency Management and Nevada Department of Health and Human Services will be temporarily aligned with the Nevada Office of the Military for the duration of the COVID-19 public health crisis to ensure that the entirety of Nevada’s State Government is utilized effectively and efficiently in response to this unprecedented emergency situation. The Office of the Military is led by Major General Ondra L. Berry, the Adjutant General for the Nevada National Guard and State of Nevada. The Governor has not formally activated the Nevada National Guard for the COVID-19 response at this time.
On March 11, 2020, Bremen (state of Germany) closes four day nurseries trying to prevent the infection with the Coronavirus, due to infected staff or as preventive measure.
On March 15, 2020, a closure until further notice of mosques and churches in all the governorates of Palestine was ordered.
India issues intensified health inspections at remaining Land Check Posts on Indo-Bhutan, Indo-Nepal, Indo-Myanmar, Indo-Bangladesh borders.

As of March 21, the Bulgarian Government decided to introduce checkpoints at the entry/exit roads to the district capitals and carry out checks on the purpose and destination of the journey. Passengers shall be admitted at the checkpoints only if the journey cannot be postponed for professional or work reasons, for reasons of health of the passenger or his/her family and for the purpose of returning to his/her place of residence or permanent residence.

In Palestine, as of March 07, "The Israeli defence ministry said it had imposed emergency measures on Bethlehem, with everybody "forbidden from entering or leaving the city". It added that the lockdown had been imposed "in coordination with the Palestinian Authority" (PA)."

Nevada, United States
 An Emergency Team be established to coordinate the response to COVID-19;

Ireland's Minister for Health signed on Apr 03 "two statutory instruments to relieve some of the pressures on GPs, pharmacists and patients accessing prescriptions called Medicinal Products Amendment Regulations 2020 allowing for electronic transfer of prescriptions to a pharmacy and increasment of the validity of a prescription."

Nevada, United States
2020-03-12 - COVID-19 Declaration of Emergency

Vanuatu, 03-31-2020," The Council of Ministers (COM) has imposed a curfew on individuals under the State of Emergency (SOE) Regulation, prohibiting individuals from leaving their residence from 9pm to 4am during the SOE period.

People are only allowed to leave their homes for emergency purposes; health reasons; or to perform a function related to an essential service."
On March 14, 2020, Hamas bans gatherings of more than 100 people in Gaza.

As of March 21, the Georgian government suspended all air movement.  With few exceptions, all flights in or out of Georgia will be on Georgian Airways and in coordination with the Georgian government.

Nevada, United States
 SECTION 1: 	All kindergarten through 12th grade schools will close to students effective March 16, 2020 until this Order is rescinded; and
 SECTION 2: 	This Order shall include all public, community, and private K-12 schools in the state but does not apply to childcare services such as daycare centers and home-based childcare providers; and
 SECTION 3: 	Schools may reopen no earlier than April 6, 2020, and only upon the approval of the Chief Medical Officer of the State of Nevada after a review of the risk of transmission within the geographic area defined by the Chief Medical Officer.
Suspend the exchange of students and student delegations abroad, unless absolutely necessary, while taking the necessary health precautions from March 4th.

The Indonesian National Police issued a declaration ("Maklumat Kapolri") to ban the hoarding of basic goods on March 19. The declaration is an emphasis on Law No. 7/2014 (Article 29) that prohibits the hoarding of goods/necessities in times of scarcity.

In Palestine, as of March 07, "The city of Bethlehem in the occupied West Bank has been placed in lockdown after the first Palestinian cases of the new coronavirus were discovered there (...) while all schools and educational facilities would close"
Russia closes Its border to foreigners from March 18 to May 1, with few exceptions
Jordan evacuates 71 students from Wuhan.

Nevada, United States
 SECTION 1: 	The Nevada general public shall cease gathering at gaming establishments, and all gaming devices, machines, tables, games, and any equipment related to gaming activity shall cease operations effective March 17, 2020, at 11:59 p.m., for the duration that this Directive shall be in effect. This prohibition does not extend to licensed online gaming or mobile wagering operations; and
 SECTION 2: 	Gaming licensees who offer hotel accommodations may remain open if needed to avoid guest displacement or for essential or emergency pU1poses; and
 SECTION 3: 	 his Directive shall remain in effect until April 16, 2020, unless renewed by a subsequent Directive promulgated pursuant to the March 12, 2020, Declaration of Emergency to facilitate the State's response to the COVID-19 pandemic.
As of March 21, 2020, the Bulgarian government introduces a prohibition to enter grocery stores and pharmacies for persons under 60 daily between 08.30 and 10.30

India issues 14 day quarantine rules based on 1. travel history (to Italy, Iran, China, Spain, France, Germany, South Korea) and 2. symptomatic passengers across remaining open Land Check Posts (Indo-Bangladesh, Indo-Nepal, Indo-Bhutan, Indo-Myanmar borders).

In Palestine, as of March 07, "The city of Bethlehem in the occupied West Bank has been placed in lockdown after the first Palestinian cases of the new coronavirus were discovered there (...) Public parks and tourist sites would close while large sporting events, conferences and other major gatherings were cancelled"

Nevada, United States
Non-Essential Businesses, as further defined in regulations promulgated under this Directive, that promote recreational social gathering activities including, but not limited to, recreation centers, clubhouses, nightclubs, movie theaters, massage parlors, adult entertainment establishments, brothels, and live entertainment venues, and any other such Non-Essential Business shall close effective March 20, 2020, at 11:59 p.m., for the duration that this Directive shall be in effect.
India suspends operation of India-Bangladesh cross border Passenger Train and Buses

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: Ethiopia is enforcing a 15-day mandatory quarantine in Addis Ababa Science and Technology University (ASTU) for passengers who cannot afford to be quarantined in designated hotels, from March 27.
On March 6th, Guatemala raises the country's alert status from yellow to red as the first case of the coronavirus (COVID-19) was recorded in Costa Rica.
The Governor of West Papua declared a state of emergency (Status Tanggap Darurat) on the region from March 27 - April 9.

Ministry of Health calls to carry out training actions for officials and executives of other ministries (education, higher education, transport, etc.) in order to contribute to the awareness-raising effort to combat COVID-19 in Tunisia from March 4th.
Taiwan CECC raises travel notice for Italy to Level 3: Warning. The CECC has also advised against all nonessential travel to Italy on Feb 27.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: Ethiopia is extending the closure of all schools for two weeks, including higher learning institutions, as of March 27.
Taiwan CECC announces that travelers arriving from Italy subject to home quarantine for 14 days on Feb 27.
As of March 30, 2020, the Bulgarian government dictates that people must wear a protective mask in public places indoors or outdoors.

Qatar's Ministry of Industry and Commerce announces the temporary suspension of street vendor activities on March 14, halting "sales, as well as the provision of all services" to "ensure public safety" in light of health circumstances.
In Palestine, as of March 07, "The city of Bethlehem in the occupied West Bank has been placed in lockdown after the first Palestinian cases of the new coronavirus were discovered there."

entry_type: Correction to Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: India suspends international passenger traffic across Land Check Points of land borders.

The provincial government issued a policy for social distancing starting from March 27 - April 9. The province will limit passenger ships, but not close seaports for cargo nor airports. Local officials are also urged to not travel across municipalities unless for very urgent matters.

On March 6th, Guatemala announces that no passenger from countries with confirmed cases may enter the airport without a clinical epidemiological evaluation. Costa Rica is now part of this list of countries.

As of March 4, Hesse (Germany) passes a new regulation which enables pharmacies, the pharmaceutical and chemical industry and legal entities under public law to produce hand and surface disinfectants faster and easier. A simple notification of the planned production of disinfectants to the responsible federal authority, the Federal Institute for Occupational Safety and Health (BAuA), is now sufficient until August 31.

Nevada, United States
 	 DMV offices are required to be closed to the public until at least April 16, 2020 to minimize the spread of the COVID-19 virus.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: The Bulgarian Ministry of Health announces that as of March 31, item 9 "All persons staying in public places inside buildings or outside are obliged to wear a face mask" created by yesterday's decree RD-01-168/ 30.03.2020 will be repealed.

On March 27, Ethiopia has identified more than 134 facilities for quarantine, isolation and treatment with varying levels of equipment, and calls upon donations to the national resource mobilization committee.

Nevada, United States
 	County School Districts, Charter Schools, and Private Schools may reopen no earlier than April 16, 2020, and only upon the approval of the Chief Medical Officer of the State of Nevada after a review of the risk of transmission within the geographic area defined by the Chief Medical Officer; and

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: On March 9th, Guatemala announces that it has organized a multidisciplinary workshop for the health staff of private hospitals to better prepare them to deal with Covid19.

The Ivory Coast has announced on the 29th of March the launching of an operation of disinfection and cleaning of all primary and secondary streets in the district Abidjan that would start on the 30th of march.

Taiwan CDC announces that In response to the development of the epidemic, medical personnel will be restricted from going abroad on Feb. 23. The target of the restriction will be mainly medical personnel directly related to the care of patients in the hospital.

Nevada, United States
 	The requirement contained in NRS 241.023(1)(b) that there be a physical location designated for meetings of public bodies where members of the public are permitted to attend and participate is suspended.
Ethiopia is enabling a tax exemption for the import of materials and equipment to be used in the prevention and containment of COVID-19, from March 27.

Kiribati makes a public awareness announcement that requires travellers to comply to the following preventive measures from 6.February:


• Avoid close contact with people suffering from acute respiratory infections
• People with symptoms of acute respiratory infection should practice cough etiquette (maintain
distance, cover coughs and sneezes with disposable tissues or clothing and wash hands)
• Avoid contact with animals (alive or dead), visiting animal markets, and purchasing products that
come from animals (such as uncooked meat).2
• Wash hands often with soap and clean water for at least 20 seconds. Use an alcohol- based
hand sanitizer if soap and water are not available.
• Older travelers and those with underlying health issues may be at risk for more severe disease
and should discuss travel to affect areas and territories with their health care provider.
• In order to minimize the risk of transmission, people travelling to the affected area should
maintain good hand and personal hygiene.
• Travelers should seek medical attention if they develop respiratory symptoms within 14 days if
visiting any other affected countries or countries with local transmissions, informing their health
service prior to their attendance about their recent travel to the affected country.

Nevada, United States
 	The Nevada general public shall not gather in groups of ten or more in any indoor or outdoor area, whether publicly owned or privately owned where the public has access by right or invitation, express or implied, whether by payment of money or not, including without limitation, parks, basketball courts, volleyball courts, baseball fields, football fields, rivers, lakes, beaches, streets, convention centers, libraries, parking lots, and private clubs. This provision shall not be construed to apply to the gathering of persons living within the same household, or persons working at or patronizing Essential Licensed Businesses or providing essential services to the public.

The Australian Government National Cabinet acting on the advice of the Australian Health Protection Principal Committee announced that from 11.59pm (local time) on 25 March 2020, all non urgent elective surgery will be temporarily suspended.
Nevada, United States

Ethiopia is demanding the National Bank of Ethiopia to avail Birr 15 billion of liquidity for private banks to enable them to provide debt relief and additional loans to customers in need, as of March 27.

On 19 February 2020, the Chennai Port Trust isolated two Chinese crew of M.V. Magnate ship and kept the vessel out-of-bounds for people from the shore. 2 out of the 19 crew members were detected to have mild fever without other respiratory symptoms, according to the Port Health Officer.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: On March 10th, Guatemala informs the population that each person or public and/or private company that wants to carry out events with more than 150 people, must ask for authorization of the activity with 48 to 72 hours of anticipation in the Health Area of their locality.

Kiribati encourages all travellers to and from Kiribati that:
"2.In the event that travel cannot be postponed; preventive measures should be adhered to at all
times.
3. In case of symptoms suggestive of acute respiratory illness before travel, travelers are
encouraged to seek medical attention and advise about travel restrictions.
4. In case of symptoms suggestive of acute respiratory illness during and after travel, travelers are
encouraged to seek medical attention and share travel history with health care providers." at the 6. of February.
Taiwan CECC raises travel notice level for Iran to Level 3: warning and advises against all non-essential travel on Mar.1.
From 17 March to 26 March there have been several GAA stadiums opened as additional test services in Ireland.

On March 1, Taiwan CECC announces that starting from March 2, travelers who have traveled to Iran in the past 14 days (transits not included) are required to follow a 14-day home quarantine after entering Taiwan.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: Ethiopia is demanding banks to avail foreign currency for importers primarily importing goods and input materials for the prevention of COVID-19 from March 27.

On 26 March 2020, the Australian National Cabinet announced that they would expand the current coronavirus testing criteria to include testing people with fever or acute respiratory infection in: all health workers; all aged/residential care workers; geographically localised areas where there is elevated risk of community transmission as defined by the local public health unit; where no community transmission is occurring, high risk settings where there are two or more plausibly-linked cases, for example:
aged and residential car; rural and remote Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities; detention centres/correctional facilities
boarding schools; military bases (including Navy ships) that have live-in accommodation. National Cabinet also agreed that testing will be expanded to include hospitalised patients with fever and acute respiratory symptoms of unknown cause, at the discretion of the treating clinician.

This is the minimum testing criteria. States and territories have the discretion to expand their own criteria for testing if they have capacity.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: On March 10th, Guatemala declares that due to the confusion surrounding mass events, notifying the health departments will be necessary, but no authorization will be issued, because, no case of COVID-19 has been confirmed in Guatemala as of yet. Notifications must be made online 48 hours to 72 hours prior to the event.
Vanuatu; 03-16-2020, Vanuatu's Ministry of Internal Affairs has banned all public servants from going on all overseas travel until further notice.
Ethiopia is increasing the amount of money individuals can transfer through mobile banking to limit in-person cash handling, from March 27.
Kiribati requires that "A Health Arrival Form is to be filled out by all incoming travelers upon arrival to Kiribati through Tarawa and Kiritimati." as of February, 6.

On March 19, 2020, Benin launches a digital platform "Infos Coronavirus" to give citizens access to official information relating to the management of the Coronavirus (Covid-19) pandemic in Benin (public awareness)

On the 27 March 2020, the Australian Government announced that all returning citizen and resident travellers will be required to undertake their mandatory 14 day self-isolation at designated facilities (for example, a hotel) from 11:59pm 28 March 2020 onwards.

In Tanzania all travellers whether foreigners or returning residents arriving from COVID-19 most affected countries, will be subjected to mandatory isolation for 14 days at their own cost at designated facilities identified by the Government from March 24.
Jordan imposes compulsory quarantine on arrivals from airports and border crossings.
As of March 16, Lower Saxony (Germany) closes child care and schools until April 18.

From March 25, South Sudan is imposing a night-time curfew from 8 pm to 6 am throughout the country, exempting health workers, journalists, and network operators, who all can go out with a written permit.
Ethiopia is removing the minimum price set by the National Bank of Ethiopia on the horticulture sector for flower exports as of March 27.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description:
Kiribati requires that "A Health Arrival Form is to be filled out and copies of e-tickets to be provided by all incoming
travellers upon arrival to Kiribati through Tarawa and Kiritimati. " as of March 17.
In Tanzania passengers should fill in Health Surveillance Form in the plane, or any other transport means and submit them to Port Health Authorities upon arrival after March 23.
As of March 16, Lower Saxony (Germany) prohibits all school trips and similar school events until the end of the 2019/2020 school year, August 26.
In Tanzania all travellers will be subjected to an intensive screening and where necessary COVID-19 rapid testing.
From March 30, the South Sudan Ministry of Health has begun a public awareness campaign across the country about COVID-19, in cooperation with UNICEF and WHO.
The provincial government restricts entry for non-residents on March 27 - April 9.

On 27 March, the European Council announced that it would emphasize providing medical equipment, with a particular focus on masks and
respirators: speeding up procedures concerning joint procurement
initiatives for personal protective equipment, ventilators and testing
supplies.

Kiribati announces that "All passengers traveling from Kiritimati to Nadi on the Honolulu-Xmas-Nadi flight need to be
quarantined in Fiji for 14 days before traveling back to Kiribati " as of March 17.

On March 10th, Guatemala announces that it will be screening all members of a new "migrant caravan" coming from Honduras, despite this country having no confirmed cases of Covid19. Those who show no signs of the coronavirus will be allowed to pass (?)

In Tanzania after 14 days quarantine, passengers who have not developed symptoms of COVID-19 may leave the facilities and will be required to register personal information for future possible tracking purpose after March 23.
On March 20, the Governor of East Java declared a state of emergency in the province.
From March 27, Ethiopia's Ministry of Revenue will expedite VAT returns to support companies with cash flows.
In Ramallah, Palestine, as of March 11, "a separate special section in the Governorate Health Directorate to diagnose cases of the emerging coronavirus" was opened.

On 13 March, the European Parliament issued a (proposed) amendment to a regulation which effectively suspends the "use it or lose it" rule, meaning that airlines are not obliged to use their planned take-off
and landing slots to keep them in the next corresponding season. This prevents airlines from feeling forced to fly empty plans.
Sierre Leone announces three day nationwide lockdown effective from April 4th.
On March 20, the government banned entry for foreigners, after the first coronavirus victim reached Syria by road from Lebanon after returning from Europe.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: As of March 13, 2020, the senator for youth and education in Bremen (Germany) released a decree requiring all day care nurseries to close until April 14, 2020. They are also requested to be available by phone for parents and information on test results.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: The Australian Government on 29 March 2020 announced that AU$669 will be provided to expand Medicare-subsidised telehealth services for all Australians, with extra incentives to GPs and other health practitioners also delivered. The new arrangements will be in place until 30 September 2020, when they will be reviewed in light of the need to continue the fight against coronavirus.
Health officials have deployed medical teams at the national level and to 1,864 health clinics across the country.
On February 21, 2020, Benin urges tourism operators to provide extra rooms to isolate potentially sick travelers showing suspicious symptoms and provides health hotline to report these cases

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: On March 13, 2020, the senate of Bremen (Germany) released a decree requiring all day care facilities to close until April 14, 2020. Furthermore, emergency day care for children whose parents work in system-relevant professions and can otherwise not take care of their children will be provided. The facilities are required to be available on the phone for emergency calls by parents as well as state coordination.

Samoa issued a public notice that wholesalers and retailers must avoid unnecessary price increases and consumers should report on any unreasonable price increases from March 23. Price controls my be introduced as a result.

Japan "adopted a policy of having asymptomatic or mildly ill patients of the COVID-19 coronavirus disease stay at home, in hotels or certain other places, in areas where infections are rapidly spreading."

As of March 17, Lower Saxony (Germany) has closed the following establishments until April 18: Bars, clubs, cultural centres, discos, pubs and similar establishments; theatres, operas, concert halls, museums, libraries and similar establishments; fairs, exhibitions, cinemas, zoos, amusement parks and animal parks, and suppliers of leisure activities (indoor and outdoor), special markets, amusement arcades, casinos, betting shops and similar establishments; prostitution facilities, brothels and similar establishments; the practice of sport in all public and private sports facilities; swimming pools, gyms, saunas and similar facilities; all playgrounds including indoor playgrounds.

On 29 March 2020, the Australian Government committed AU$74 million  to support the mental health and wellbeing of all Australians. Of which, AU$10 million will be provided to create a dedicated coronavirus wellbeing support line. AU$14 million will bolster the capacity of mental health support providers who have experienced an unprecedented surge in call volumes with funding increasing their capacity, including $5 million for Lifeline and $2 million for Kids Helpline.

In Japan, from April 3rd, 2020, "Tokyo metropolitan government has decided to introduce measures including leasing hotels within its jurisdiction as temporary accommodations for COVID-19 patients with mild symptoms and asking those infected to stay at home to recuperate."

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: As of March 16, 2020, all teaching is suspended until April 14, 2020 in both public and private schools in the state. Facilities are self-responsible to provide alternative means of teaching in due course.
"The prefectural government of Osaka, western Japan, decided [on April 2nd, 2020] to extend the closures of high schools and special-needs schools run by the prefecture until May 6[th, 2020.]"
Seychelles monitors all passengers incoming from China - Measures in place for Coronavirus outbreak

On the 29 March 2020, the Australian Government announced that both indoor and outdoor gatherings will be restricted to two persons only, with exceptions: People of the same household going out together; Funerals - a maximum of 10 people;  Wedding - a maximum of 5 people; Family units.

Zimbabwe will impose a nationwide lockdown for 21 days from Monday to help curb the spread of the coronavirus, and security forces may be deployed to enforce it, President Emmerson Mnangagwa said on Friday by Independent Online Digital media.
On March 11th, Guatemala announces that it will prohibit citizens from Europe, China, Korea and Iran from entering the country, starting on March 12th.
As of March 22 all nightclubs, bars, theaters, bars attached to restaurants or hotels, or any other public place people accustom for social gatherings are to be closed in Samoa.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description:
Nevada, United States
The March 12, 2020 Declaration of Emergency is hereby extended to April 30, 2020. All Directives promulgated pursuant to this Declaration shall be in force for the duration that the Declaration of Emergency shall be in effect, unless specifically terminated by a subsequent order.

As of March 17, Lower Saxony (Germany) prohibits gatherings in public with more than 10 people as well as private events with more than 50 people. It further prohibts all public events as well as meetings in associations and other sports and leisure facilities, in adult education centres, music schools and other public and private educational institutions in the extracurricular sector; coach trips; meetings in churches, mosques, synagogues and the meetings of other faith communities, including meetings in community centres until April 18.
In Japan, "[t]he education board of the Tokyo metropolitan government decided [on April 1st, 2020] to extend school closures for preventing the spread of the novel coronavirus to May 6th, 2020".

Luxemburg banned third-country nationals to enter the territory of the Grand Duchy. The restriction was put in place, initially, for a one month period starting on March 18, 2020.  There are several exemptions from this ban, including for  Belgian, French, and German cross-border workers.

Nevada, United States
With limited exceptions identified below, all Nevadans are ordered to stay in their residences. Gatherings of individuals outside the home is prohibited, subject to the same exceptions.
On March 26th, 2020, Japan's Kanagawa prefecture issued a request to its residents not to visit Tokyo on the weekend of March 28th/29th, 2020.

Latvian Finance Minister Jānis Reirs’ initiated a work group for support of entrepreneurship and the employed on Wednesday. At 1 April they decided to finance efforts to battle consequences from COVID-19 from the state budget. The work group ordered Economy Ministry to develop an economic recovery plan.
Later EU funds might be needed, Finance Ministry work group will review proposals on distribution of funding from EU funds.
On March 11th, Guatemala announces that Guatemalans coming from Europe who do not present symptoms when arriving in the country will be quarantined for at least 7 days in their homes.
The Chadian Ministry of Public Health put 1557 people under quarantine during the last weeks. 412 have completed the quarantine.
Seychelles Department of Health announces mass media campaigns on 31 January 2020 - Measures in place for Coronavirus outbreak

Latvian government and public agencies (without further specification) will use remote methods of communication rather than face-to-face interviews wherever possible from March 12th

The Russian President establishes a State Council to address the spread of coronavirus on March 15.
In Palestine, as of March 23, "Palestinian President Mahmud Abbas issued an amnesty order Sunday for some civil detainees as part of efforts to contain the spread of the novel coronavirus."
The regency council (kabupaten) of Trenggalek declared a state of emergency, to take into effect from March 26 until May 29. The declaration was made through SK Bupati No. 360/422/406.029/2020.

On March 13, Latvia (Prime Minister + Finance Minister + Central Bank Governor) announces financial instruments (a billion-euro fund) to assist businesses via the state-owned ALTUM development bank. Possible measures are e.g.: tax holidays, paying for sick leave, import and export guarantees

As of March 17, Lower Saxony (Germany) demands that hospitals, prevention and rehabilitation facilities as well as homes for the elderly or for people in need of care or people with disabilities take measures to enforce general bans on visiting or entering. It further prohibits the operation of all daily care facilities. Both is in effect until April 18.

The Russian government establishes a new website https://xn--80aesfpebagmfblc0a.xn--p1ai/ofdoc/ as a comprehensive information portal from March 15.

In Japan, "[t]he heads of four prefectures and five ordinance-designated major cities in the Tokyo metropolitan area [(Tokyo, Saitama, Chiba, and Kanagawa prefectures; mayors of the cities of Yokohama, Chiba, Saitama, Sagamihara, and Kawasaki)] issued on [April 1st, 2020] an emergency message calling on residents to refrain from going out at nighttime".

Ethiopia expands correction facilities and utilises other holding spaces to avoid overcrowding, while new prisoners will be tested, visits will be suspended and prisoners with minor offences and near released date will be released from imprisonment as of March 20.
The provincial government of East Java applied a closure of schools starting from March 16 - 29. The closure applies for senior high schools and vocational schools (SMA & SMK).
On March 19, Latvia relieves alcohol used for the production of disinfectants from excise tax (part of an comprehensive law on support measures for Covid-19-related damages and threats
In Palestine, on March 09, The Palestinian Ministry of the Interior in Ramallah announced (...) beginning of combating the rumors spread about the emerging Coronavirus (Covid 19)."

As of March 17, Lower Saxony (Germany) restricts ferry and flight operations to the islands of Lower Saxony with the following provisions until April 18: ferry and flight operations are to be prohibited from transporting persons to the islands of Lower Saxony who cannot prove their first place of residence on this island. Tourists who are already staying on the Lower Saxon islands of the North Sea are to leave until March 25.

On March 20, 2020, Benin calls the general population for participation in the public awareness campaign, by uploading content in different national languages (languages of Benin, such as Fon, Goun, Yoruba etc)
Ethiopia's northern Tigray regional state on Thursday, March 26, announced a region-wide state of emergency as a means of combating the coronavirus pandemic for 15 days.

As of March 17, 2020, the state of Bremen (Germany) requires all citizens, coming back from declared risk areas to self-quarantine for 14 days. The areas of high risk are declared by the German Robert-Koch-Institute. Furthermore, people in self-quarantine are required to check on their health and bodily temperature twice daily.
On March 30, four regional states of Ethiopia (Tigray, Oromia, Amhara and Southern Nations, Nationalities and Peoples) imposed a ban on transport.
"Prefectural governments across Japan are accelerating efforts to secure hospital beds".

Seychelles students are repatriated from China due to COVID-19 on 28 January.
On March 30, four regional states of Ethiopia (Tigray, Oromia, Amhara and Southern Nations, Nationalities and Peoples) imposed a ban on transport.

Japan's "Tokyo Metropolitan Government officials plan to secure up to 4,000 hospital beds to accept new coronavirus patients".
Spain (islas canarias) receives from the Chinese community in Tenerife medical material against COVID-19 on april 2
The provincial government of South Sumatra announced a state of emergency in the province, from March 24.

Russia's regions are directed on March 13 to test everyone who has been in Europe in the past two weeks, or who have returned from abroad within the previous month and are showing symptoms of the coronavirus

In Palestine, on March 07, Gaza Strip schools were closed (...) in implementation of the decision of the Ministry of Education, as part of the precautionary measures against the Corona virus."

The provincial government of West Java declared a state of emergency from March 19 - May 29.
Hungarian citizens who reside abroad must either leave Hungary or comply with quarantine regulations even if they show no symptoms of COVID-19
Seychelles bans all travel to and from China on 29 Jan 2020.

On March 2, Taiwan CECC announces that starting March 5, everyone to be allowed for one additional face mask every week due to increased production. Adults will be eligible for three face masks and children will be allowed for five masks every seven days, under name-based system.
Spain (Mallorca, Ibiza) sets up two hotels for health professionals starting April 2
Taiwan CECC issues Guidelines for Large-Scale Public Gatherings to prevent widespread community transmissions on March 05.
In the Gaza Strip in Palestine, on March 02, a "quarantine center [was] set up by the Ministry of Health at the Rafah Crossing to host arrivals from China and countries that have spread "Corona"."
Spain (Balears)  The Government of the Balearic Islands has 10,000 tests to detect SARS-CoV-2 antibodies starting March 30
The Governor of Central Kalimantan declared a state of emergency, March 20.

On March 10th, Japan extends the validity of the Certificate of Eligibility from 3 months to 6 months for those applications affected by complications due to COVID-19. The policy is retroactive for CoE issued within the prior 3 months. Expired CoE issued within the prior 6 months can be extended through a letter of the receiving institution.
Russia directs regional governments to limit mass gatherings as of March 13.
Spain (Mallorca)  creates a COVID-19 Coordination Center to centralize the management of patients with coronavirus in primary care in Mallorca starting March 28

under the guidance of the National Security Conference of the Presidential Office, the Homeland Security Office of the Executive Yuan and experts, the Taiwan CECC jointly develop the "Enterprises in Response to Serious Special Infections Guidelines for the Continuous Operation of Epidemic Pneumonia (COVID-19)" on March 05 to reduce the impact of the epidemic on the operation of the enterprise.

The Republic of Ireland "will close the following institutions to students: educational institutions including creches or kindergartens, primary and secondary schools" as well as "higher educational institutions, including universities, research institutes and so on". As of March 18, 2020, the state of Bremen (Germany) suspends all day care facilities for the elderly to close. Emergency day care can still be applied for and provided.

Taiwan CECC raised its travel notice level to Level 2: Alert for France, Germany and Spain, in the wake of rapid increases in the numbers of coronavirus disease on March 7. The CECC also advised travelers visiting these countries to take enhanced precautions.
The Governor of Central Kalimantan ordered the closure of schools, from March 18 - 31.

Spain launches public awareness and information campaign #EsteVirusLoParamosUnidos (We are stopping this virus together) directed at all citizens starting from March 15, the campaign reminds people to stay at home, wash their hands frequently, no to share fake news, amongst others - it is distributed on different kinds of public and private media

Nepal on Sunday evacuated 175 of its nationals from the Chinese city of Wuhan, the epicenter of a coronavirus outbreak, an official said, after protests by parents of students studying in the city.

A plane operated by state-owned Nepal Airlines carrying 134 men and 41 women, mostly students, landed at Kathmandu’s Tribhuvan International Airport before dawn, Health Minisitry spokesman Mahendra Shrestha said.
In Gaza, Palestine, as of March 07, a quarantine of 14 days is imposed on everyone coming through the border crossings from the countries affected by the coronavirus.

King of Morocco ordered the creation of a $1 billion fund to upgrade health infrastructure and help vulnerable economic sectors to counter coronavirus spread. 185 million Euros invested in medical equipment: 100,000 testing kits. Money comes from a special fund dedicated to Covid-10 management. Other equipment bought: medication, 1,000 hospital beds, 550 ventilators and other Health Ministry functions.

On the 21st March 2020, The Swiss Federal Department of Foreign Affairs (FDFA) releases the plan to return 630 Swiss tourists from Latin America (Peru & Colombia) in cooperation with the airline Edelweiss, with Two charter flights planned for 24-25 March 2020.
Spain (Mallorca)  creates three new COVID-express units in Mallorca for rapid sample collection and testing for coronavirus starting March 26
Hungary forbids gatherings of more than 100 people in a closed place and of more than 500 people in an open place
Taiwan CECC advices travelers entering Taiwan from France, German, and Spain are subject to a 14-day period of self-health management on March 07.

Hungary announced that it would deport any non-Hungarian citizen who refuses to comply with quarantine guidelines
Russia directs regional governments to work with businesses to create disinfection procedures, and to directly oversee sanitary procedures in food service and retail sectors, beginning March 13.
King of Morocco orders on March 20th field hospitals to be set up across the country to assist with health services.

The mechanism will allow people to order at a designated website using their NHI card or Citizen Digital Certificate or through the NHI app other than pharmacies.

KATHMANDU (Reuters) - Nepal on Sunday evacuated 175 of its nationals from the Chinese city of Wuhan, the epicenter of a coronavirus outbreak, an official said, after protests by parents of students studying in the city.

A plane operated by state-owned Nepal Airlines carrying 134 men and 41 women, mostly students, landed at Kathmandu’s Tribhuvan International Airport before dawn, Health Minisitry spokesman Mahendra Shrestha said.
Hungary announced that law enforcement and public administration workers, health workers, contract soldiers, and military personnel may not travel abroad

All Nepalese 175 evacuees will have their health examined at the airport. Those having no symptom of COVID-19 will be taken to Kharipati, while those showing symptoms of the disease will be taken to Sukraraj Tropical and Infectious Disease Hospital, Patan Hospital or Armed Police Force Hospital, Balambu.

The health team deployed to Wuhan will stay in Kharipati for 14 days, while the crew will be quarantined in Telkot for at least 14 days
From 13th March and two weeks forward, Libyan schools close.

On the 14th of March, Guatemala announces that all patients affected by the Covid19 are to be accepted by hospitals. A distance of a minimum of 1.5 meters is to be kept between persons at all times, this applies to moving around in public spaces and possible contact in shops and similar establishments which are still allowed to remain open for provisions.

Since the past week, the State Government has put in place tough measures to contain the spread of the epidemic. In the morning of last Tuesday (17), Governor Wilson Witzel decreed, with the objective of preventing the spread of the virus, the emergency situation by Covid-19, with a recommendation to limit the service to the public in bars and restaurants, reduction of hours in shopping centers, in addition to the suspension of classes in public and private schools, among other measures.

Seychelles Department of Health announced on Facebook that it is enforcing two-week quarantine on all travellers including Seychelles citizens that visited China, Macau and Hong Kong on starting 6 February 2020.

On Friday, Jan 24, the authorities in Nepal said a student who had returned to the country from China had been confirmed to be infected with the coronavirus. He has already been treated and released.

Dr. Anup Bastola, a spokesman for the government-run Sukraraj Tropical and Infectious Diseases Hospital, said a 32-year-old doctoral student was admitted to the hospital on Jan. 13 after having some respiratory problems.

Concerned over his symptoms, the doctors sent samples of his blood and sputum for testing. Later, he was found to be infected with the  virus that emerged from Wuhan, China.

On March 16th, Guatemala announces that no worker who presents symptoms of Covid19 can apply his minimum labour rights and has the obligation to go immediately to a health center or hospital. Barbados issued a warning against spreading false information on social media about the Government’s workplace policy in respect of Covid-19. Spreading false information about Government policies is prohibited under the Computer Misuse Act.
Mandalay (Myanmar) restricts entry and exit of all kinds of vehicles from April 7 until April 21.
The Royal Barbados Police Force (RBPF) is closing police station tours for groups and schools.
Mandalay city shuts down all hotels, guesthouses, and nonessential businesses from April 7 to April 21.

entry_type: Update on Existing Entry for record ID ${e://Field/record_id} (<- if no record ID listed, type in Record ID in text box)
event_description: The Governor of Oregon on March 12th announced an Executive Order banning gatherings larger than 25 which will remain in place until April 28th.
Yangon (Myanmar) urges people to stay home during the annual Thingyan Festival holiday from April 10 to April 19, except for those active in essential businesses/services.

Barbados declares that it is currently in Stage 1 after the island recorded the first cases of COVID-19 on March 17th. Activation of National Emergency Operations Centre and Isolation Centre. Preparation of severe treatment facility and Paragon, St. Lucy District Hospital or Field Medical Hospital for screening, quarantine and isolation. Reconfiguring of polyclinics to facilitate local screening. Advice on limiting mass gathering to reduce risk for local spread. Suspension Of Visits & Closure Of Public Health Institutions.

Barbados is limiting public access to the Community Legal Services Commission suite of offices at the Supreme Court Complex. Members of the public who wish to inquire about, or apply for legal aid services, are asked to first make initial contact with the department by calling 535-9900. A decision will then be made as to whether the caller should attend at the office in person, or be interviewed via telephone.

Barbados's Queen Elizabeth Hospital is restricting visiting hours. The new interim visiting hours across all general and surgical wards are 12:00 noon to 1:00 p.m. and 5:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily. Visits to the hospital’s Intensive Care Units – Medical Intensive Care Unit, Surgical Intensive Care Unit, Paediatric Intensive Care Unit, and Neonatal Intensive Care Unit – will be facilitated between 11:00 and 11:30 a.m.; 4:00 and 4:30 p.m.; and 5:30 and 6:00 p.m. Patients are only allowed 2 visitors at the time and visits cannot be longe than 2 hours. All visitors will be required to go through temperature tests at entrance.

The Barbados Postal Service has advised that the Post Office will not be accepting mail for international destinations, as this service will be temporarily suspended. Incoming international mail will still be processed. Local mail services will continue to operate.

Barbados announcing penalties for persons who have been ordered to self-quarantine in their homes but fail to do so. Failure to comply may result in the offender being placed in mandatory quarantine at a health facility. Disobeying can also result in a maximum fine of $5000.00, or imprisonment of up to 12 months or both.
Barbados restricts public visits to Her Majesty’s Prisons Dodds.

Barbados enacts the Emergency Management (COVID-19) Curfew Directive, 2020. Under the Order, a curfew is in effect from Saturday, March 28, until Tuesday, April 14, while all businesses, except essential services and those identified, were ordered close as Government seeks to contain the spread of COVID-19. The curfew is between 8 pm and 6 am. Attorney General Dale Marshall announced that there will be a fine of $50,000, or one year in prison, or both, for anyone found guilty of breaking the curfew.

The Marshall Islands imposed a travel ban for all incoming travelers entering directly from the People's Republic of China on 24-01-2020.
Any traveler with travel originating from or transiting through the PRC must spend at least 14 days in a country not affected by 2019-nCoV.

On March 30, the Governor of North Sumatra declared that a state of emergency would take place in the province from March 30 - May 29.
In Austria, for Easter holidays, the governement announced that meetings are only allowed in a closed room if "no more than five people who do not live in the same household participate"
The Indonesian Ministry of Religious Affairs suspends officiating of marriages from April 1. Marriage registrations are to be conducted online.
Portugal suspended "all classroom and non-teaching activities in schools at all levels of education as of next Monday, March 16"

Portugal started the "organization of public services, namely the reinforcement of digital services, the establishment of frequency limitations to ensure the possibility of maintaining a safe distance and the centralization of information to citizens about the presence of services"

Tunisia has turned to robots to help enforce its nationwide lockdown measures as the country continues to battle the global Coronavirus pandemic. The P Guard robots, manufactured by local company ENOVA can be operated remotely and come equipped with infrared cameras, which cover the robots surroundings, as well as a thermal camera and a sound and light alarm system. It is unclear which public official spotted their potential for policing Tunisia’s lockdown, but their presence upon the streets of the capital have provided Tunis’ locked in residents with a sorely needed source of distraction.
On March 16, 2020, Czech Regional Hygiene Station in Olomouc introduces quarantine for minimum of 14 days for more than 20 municipalities in the area due to significant spread of COVID-19 disease

Russian president announces March 30-April 3 as paid days off

On March 14, it was announced that Chinese doctors were coming to work in Tunisia. Stocks of antibacterial gels and protective masks will also be supplied by China. According to Doctor Dhaker Lahidheb, a doctor practicing at the Tunis Military Hospital, a team of high-level Chinese doctors will soon travel to Tunisia, provided with effective drugs designed, according to him, to fight against the coronavirus.
In a statement released the same evening, the Presidency of the Republic of Tunisia welcomed the Chinese initiative.

Taiwan CECC raises travel notice for certain European, Middle Eastern countries (Austria, Bahrain, Belgium, Denmark, Iceland, Kuwait, the Netherlands, Norway, Sweden, and Switzerland) to Level 2: Alert; travelers advised to take adequate precautionary measures on March 11.

23.03.2020 Commissioner Stevens issues direction to close businesses and venues in South Australia

Taiwan CECC announces that starting 2 pm of March 14, travelers yet on board leaving 27 European countries or Dubai are required to practice a 14-day home quarantine after entering Taiwan on March 14.

One of these units is the call centre, charged with receiving calls.

Individuals should seek medical attention if they develop respiratory symptoms within 14 days of visiting Wuhan [...]".

02.04.2020 South Australia prohibits Point of Care Serology tests for COVID-19 testing
On April 1, Cameroon's Minister of Public Health announced over Twitter that individuals should wear face masks when going outside.

In Mauritania a crisis committee was created called "Covid-19 contamination control committee chaired by whose main task is to coordinate and follow up directives aimed at fight against the Coronavirus starting with the implementation of the following decisions: 
1. The creation of a scientific committee, which must set up a training program on hygiene measures and medical care for suspected or confirmed patients.
2. The strengthening of the Hospital Hygiene and Nosocomial Infection Control Committee, through a new specific mission to combat COVID-19 contamination.
3. The creation of hand washing points from Tuesday, March 17, 2020 at the front door of the Center.
4. Reactivation of staff awareness on the importance of hygiene measures and multi-daily cleaning of surfaces.
5. The limitation to the strict minimum of patient visits and the number of accompanying persons per patient.
6. A 50% reduction in the number of consultations and avoiding crowding of patients in waiting rooms by respecting the distance of one meter between patients.
Seychelles closes school for 14 days from 16 March 2020 onwards.
Cameroon's Ministry of Health released a press release on March 18, 2020 recommending that people maintain a social distancing of 1 meter, and respect hygiene rules.

All Mass gatherings are prohibited
Mass gatherings are events that bring together 100 or more

The following measures will be implemented:

Sports events in Catalonia (professional and non-professional) will be held behind closed doors. In the case of events in which minors participate, players may be accompanied by adults.
Collective activities that involve gatherings of more than 1000 people, whether held in closed or open spaces, will be suspended or postponed.  When such events are held in spaces with a capacity of less than 1000 people, they may be held only if they occupy one third or less of the maximum authorised capacity. This provision is aimed at ensuring sufficient spatial separation between participants.
These restrictive measures will apply to public, recreational and leisure events, as well as cultural, religious or similar activities, regardless of whether they are offered by a public or private proprietor, operator or organiser.
The measures that apply to the public administration will be established shortly. In this case, the Directorate-General for the Civil Service will issue instructions to all affected institutions.

I, John W. Hellerstedt, M.D., Commissioner of the Department of State Health Services, do hereby certify that the introduction and spread of the communicable disease known as COVID-19 in the State of Texas has created an immediate threat, poses a high risk of death to a large number of people and creates a substantial risk of public exposure because of the disease’s method of transmission and evidence that there is community spread in Texas.

Therefore, in accordance with the authority vested in me by Section 81.082(d) of the Texas Health and Safety Code, I do hereby declare a state of public health disaster for the entire State of Texas.

Pursuant to Section 81.002 of the code, each person shall act responsibly to prevent and control communicable disease. The following actions, taken immediately, will reduce and delay the spread of COVID-19:

People, businesses and communities should immediately undertake hygiene, cleanliness and sanitation practices that are accessible, affordable and known to be effective against COVI D-19.

Avoid close contact with people who are sick.

People who are known to have, or are under investigation or monitoring, for COVID-19, should adhere to the direction provided to them by duly authorized persons, including public health officials. Failure to abide by such direction may result in involuntary quarantine or isolation for the purposes of preventing further community spread of COVI D-19.

People who are especially those with symptoms consistent with influenza or COVID 19, should isolate themselves at home until they recover. Such persons should only present for medical evaluation and their symptoms are such they cannot continue to be cared for their home. And, when seeking medical care should call their doctor or health care facility before arriving to allow them to prepare.

Limit trips into the public to essential outings. Traveling to work, the grocery store, the pharmacy or to seek medical care would be considered essential trips.

Limit as much as possible close contact with other people. Stay feet away.

In Scotland, new guidance has been issued on coronavirus that includes workplace advice. Issued on March 9, it targets non-healthcare settings such as hotels, leisure facilities, entertainment venues and other work environments or public spaces.
